intro: Silene morii, commonly known as the Morii campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink or white flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cold, arid environments. Silene morii is adapted to harsh conditions, with a short growing season and specialized root systems for water retention. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine flora and plant adaptation strategies.
